revision.comment: /* Discrepancy in date of laying keel */ re
revision.text: {{Talk header}} {{ArticleHistory| action1 = GAN | action1date = 17 January 2011 | action1link = Talk:SMS Thüringen/GA1 | action1result = listed | action1oldid = 408397869 |action2=GTC |action2date=04:43, 18 February 2011 |action2link=Wikipedia:Featured topic candidates/Helgoland class battleships/archive1 |action2result=promoted |action3=GTC |action3date=02:55, 25 August 2011 |action3link=Wikipedia:Featured topic candidates/Battleships of Germany/archive1 |action3result=promoted | action4 = WAR | action4date = 21:14, 23 December 2012 (UTC) | action4link = Wikipedia:WikiProject Military history/Assessment/SMS Thüringen | action4result = approved | action4oldid = 528870175 |ftname=Battleships of Germany |action5=FAC |action5date=10:03, 08 June 2013 |action5link=Wikipedia:Featured article candidates/SMS Thüringen/archive1 |action5result=promoted |action5oldid=558886847 | currentstatus=FA | itndate = | dykdate =19 January 2011 | dykentry=... that the [[German Empire|German]] [[dreadnought]] battleship '''[[SMS Thüringen|SMS ''Thüringen'']]''' destroyed the [[British Empire|British]] [[armored cruiser]] {{HMS|Black Prince|1904|6}} at the [[Battle of Jutland]]? | topic =War |four=no }} {{WikiProjectBannerShell|1= {{WikiProject Germany|class=FA|importance=low }} {{WikiProject Military history |class=FA |A-Class=pass |German=yes |Maritime-task-force=yes |WWI-task-force=yes |OMT=1 }} {{WikiProject Ships|class=FA}} }} == Scrapped or Sunk? == Simple Internet searches indicate this ship was scrapped after the war. However, divers are reporting that a wreck of the ship still exists. See: http://www.bobhenneman.info/Thuringenwreck.htm Thanks, [[User:Carl Gusler|Carl Gusler]] 22:40, 13 September 2007 (UTC) :It appears to have been scrapped partially, with the 350 foot section of hull left underwater. I incorporated this info into the text of the article. Hope that helps. [[User:Parsecboy|Parsecboy]] ([[User talk:Parsecboy|talk]]) 19:14, 25 January 2008 (UTC) ==picture== I think, this picture is not the battleship ''SMS Thüringen''!! I mean, its the cruiser ''SMS Blücher'', because the ship had only two funnels (similar Westphalen-class) and the side turrets are on the main deck. --[[Benutzer:URTh|URTh]] 09:34, 27. Apr. 2009 (CEST) —Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/212.122.61.138|212.122.61.138]] ([[User talk:212.122.61.138|talk]]) 07:40, 27 April 2009 (UTC) :That's correct, the photograph is definitely ''Blücher''. This was discovered on Commons a while ago; I thought I had removed it from this article already, but apparently I hadn't. Thanks for pointing it out. [[User:Parsecboy|Parsecboy]] ([[User talk:Parsecboy|talk]]) 11:21, 27 April 2009 (UTC) == Discrepancy in date of laying keel == In the first paragraph, it cites the keel lay date as Nov 1908. In the paragraph under 'Construction' right below it, it cites it as Nov 1909. Don't know which one is accurate but clearly one is off. — Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/199.242.0.29|199.242.0.29]] ([[User talk:199.242.0.29|talk]]) 19:26, 11 June 2013 (UTC) :Just a typo - thanks for catching that. [[User:Parsecboy|Parsecboy]] ([[User talk:Parsecboy|talk]]) 19:36, 11 June 2013 (UTC)
